CatDescriptText: Mrs. Robert Watts, 3101 Camp Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 31, 1958, pg. A1 question reads: "Do you think people follow political leadership more than religious leadership? Why?" answer reads: "I think that the politician holds first attention.  He seems to be everything now.  You can't get a job without him."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert Watts, wearing five button herringbone coat, holding light colored handbag over left arm, standing on Liberty Avenue with May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
